title: (x) Cockney Pub, Århus, Denmark - ITC Benguiat, Georgia {Florian, Yves}
content:
Hi typophiles,

I have attached a jpg-file with the logo of my favorite pub. Can you help me identity the fonts used in it? (Especially the upper-most one.)

Thanks,  
Emil Hedevang

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Cockney Pub.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422033430/http:/typophile.com/files/Cockney%20Pub.jpg) | 28.01 KB |

 [‹ (x) What is Boston Ultra ripped off from? - Poster Bodoni {Rainer}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422033430/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44128 "Go to previous forum topic") ["Field Day" nice fat high-contrast serif face ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422033430/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44103 "Go to next forum topic")
author: emilhedevang

comments.content: Oh my, this service is seriously overstaffed. ;-p
Yeah, sometimes I feel guilty for staying away, but then when I come back and participate I feel redundant. :^P

Exactly.  
Must have been something like the tenth ‘double strike’ in one day.  
No matter if the request is online for 2 minutes or 5 hours – when I start typing my answer, somebody else hase already done so a few seconds ago, or will do a few seconds later. Amazing, isn’t it?

_No matter if the request is online for 2 minutes or 5 hours – when I start typing my answer, somebody else has already done so a few seconds ago, or will do a few seconds later._

... unless the request was posted in a secret place:

[http://typophile.com/node/44118](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422033430/http:/typophile.com/node/44118 "http://typophile.com/node/44118")

;-)

Yeah, he looks like a typical Cockney I must say.

Nick Cooke

Wow! Thanks for the quick response, and links to the fonts! I could hardly ask for more. Except, of course, for a beer from the pub, but that would not be fair at all. :-)

Emil Hedevang
